```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```



```{r innlestur_gogn}
es <- read.table("husnaedi.txt", header=TRUE, sep=";", fileEncoding = "utf8")

```

```{r hverfi}
library(dplyr)
hverfi <- c(72,100,130)
es <- filter(es, matssvaedi%in%hverfi)
es$matssvaedi <- factor(es$matssvaedi, levels=c(72,100,130), labels=c("Hagar/Melar", "Laugarneshverfi/Vogar", "Grafarvogur"))

```

```{r }
ggplot(data = es, aes(fill=teg_eign, matssvaedi)) + geom_bar(position="dodge") + xlab("Hverfi") +ylab("Fjöldi")
```
```{r einbyli}
einbyli <- filter(es, teg_eign== "Einbýlishús")
ggplot(data = einbyli, aes(fill=matssvaedi)) + geom_bar(position="dodge") + xlab("Hverfi") +ylab("Fjöldi")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
